title: CFO Consultant
description:
**About Our Team:**



Christy Paddock Advisors, LLC is continuing to grow and has a new opening for a qualified and experienced accounting professional to join our team as a CFO Consultant. Christy Paddock Advisors has been in business since 2016, assisting organizations throughout the greater Indianapolis area with their finance and accounting needs. For more information about our business and our team of professionals, please visit our website at ChristyPaddockAdvisors.com.


**About the Role:**



As a CFO Consultant you will join our team of professionals to provide accounting and reporting services to various clients. You will work closely with business owners and finance teams to help streamline processes, close and reconcile financial records, manage cash, provide timely and accurate reporting, and work toward the company’s financial goals. We also help businesses buy and sell companies and complete interim, project, and assessment\-based work.



Our consultants work normal business hours, experience a variety of industries, and leverage their natural curiosities and skills to make a difference. Growth and promotions are based on ability and how fast someone wants to learn, not waiting for someone to retire. Our staff is comprised of highly skilled, quick learners, with great personalities. We enjoy our work, are excited about opportunities, and have fun!


**What You’ll Do:**

* Act as trusted financial advisor to CEOs/founders/leadership: develop strategy, monitor financial health, and drive performance improvement.
* Oversee or guide the finance function of client engagements: budgeting, forecasting, cash‑flow management, KPI dashboards.
* Implement or enhance financial controls, reporting systems and processes.
* Conduct financial and operational analysis: identify cost savings, revenue opportunities, and efficiency gains.
* Support funding rounds, acquisitions, or exit planning where applicable.
* Work across multiple client engagements simultaneously, managing scope, timelines and deliverables.
* Build relationships with clients, understand their business model, and tailor solutions accordingly.


**About You:**


* Bachelor’s degree in accounting or related field is required. CPA and/or MBA is preferred.
* 8\+ years of senior accounting experience, with at least 2 years in public accounting, is strongly preferred. Prior CFO, or similar, experience is a plus.
* Proficient in financial modeling (three‑statement models, scenario planning, breakeven/risk/sensitivity analysis).
* Proven track record of improving financial performance, streamlining operations, and advising executive teams.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills—able to present complex financial information to non‑finance executives.
* Able to work independently in a remote/fractional consulting structure, managing multiple engagements and priorities. Ability to also work as part of a team.
* Possess a positive attitude, be able to produce our core focus, and exhibit our core values.
* Proficient in financial systems (QuickBooks, NetSuite, Xero, etc.), AI, BI/dashboard tools and advanced Excel skills.


**Why Join Us:**



We’re growing rapidly and constantly evolving, allowing our team members to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We’re committed to supporting your happiness, health, and overall well\-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks, including:


* **Dynamic and Innovative Work:** An opportunity to play a critical role within a rapidly growing firm with a supportive and collaborative culture.
* **Growth Opportunities:** A dynamic and supportive environment where your contributions will directly impact the firm’s growth and success and share in the rewards.
* **Collaborative Culture:** A team\-oriented culture that values innovation, entrepreneurial spirit, and growth mindset.
* **Competitive Compensation:** A comprehensive salary and benefits package, including performance\-based incentives and growth opportunities.


*Christy Paddock Advisors, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.*

title: Head of Finance
description:
**About Maneva**


Maneva is an AI services company founded by a former Google DeepMind researcher, focused on transforming manufacturing operations through advanced AI. We enable autonomous factory operation and optimization by generating AI\-driven actions and insights using off\-the\-shelf hardware or existing vision systems.


Our solutions address real\-world manufacturing challenges across product and equipment inspection, production efficiency, safety, and operational performance—delivering measurable impact without requiring heavy infrastructure changes.

**Role Overview**


Maneva is seeking an experienced Head of Finance to lead all financial functions and serve as a core member of the company’s leadership team. This role is critical to building the financial foundation required to scale Maneva from early traction through sustained, large\-scale growth.


As Head of Finance, you will own financial strategy, systems, and discipline across the company—partnering closely with the CEO and leadership team to support growth, capital efficiency, and long\-term value creation. You will transition finance operations from a fractional model to a fully owned, internal function and build the financial infrastructure needed to scale a high\-growth SaaS business.


This is a hands\-on, builder role suited for a finance leader who has successfully scaled startups from early revenue to $100M\+ and understands both strategic finance and day\-to\-day operational rigor.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Financial Leadership \& Strategy**

* Own Maneva’s end\-to\-end financial function, including budgeting, forecasting, cash management, and long\-term financial planning.
* Develop and maintain robust financial models to support growth planning, scenario analysis, and strategic decision\-making.
* Partner with the CEO and leadership team to evaluate business performance, unit economics, and investment priorities.
* Establish financial discipline and operating cadence appropriate for a rapidly scaling SaaS company.

**Financial Operations \& Systems**

* Take over day\-to\-day financial ownership from the fractional CFO, including oversight of bookkeeping and accounting operations.
* Implement, optimize, and scale financial systems and processes (e.g., QuickBooks, Rippling, expense management, reporting workflows).
* Design and enforce financial policies, controls, and approval frameworks to support responsible growth.
* Collaborate closely with Business Operations to ensure alignment across planning, execution, and reporting.

**Reporting, KPIs \& Insights**

* Define, track, and report on key financial and operational KPIs across the business.
* Produce clear, actionable financial reporting for leadership, supporting data\-driven decision\-making.
* Ensure timely, accurate visibility into burn, runway, revenue performance, and expense trends.

**Fundraising \& Capital Readiness**

* Keep fundraising financials, models, and supporting materials up to date and investor\-ready.
* Support diligence processes and investor communications as needed, including participation in relevant email threads and preparation of financial materials.
* Ensure the company is structurally and financially prepared for future fundraising events.

**Grants \& Non\-Dilutive Funding**

* Own financial management and reporting for grants and non\-dilutive funding programs.
* Ensure compliance with grant requirements, tracking of eligible expenses, and accurate reporting.

**Risk, Compliance \& Governance**

* Oversee tax, compliance, and regulatory considerations in partnership with external advisors.
* Ensure strong financial controls, audit readiness, and risk management practices as the company scales.

**Requirements**

**Qualifications**

* Experience: 10\+ years of progressive experience in finance leadership roles, with demonstrated success scaling a startup or high\-growth SaaS company from early traction to $100M\+ in revenue.
* Startup Scaling: Proven ability to build financial infrastructure, processes, and systems in fast\-moving, resource\-constrained environments.
* Strategic \& Operational Depth: Comfortable operating at both the strategic level (models, planning, growth economics) and the operational level (systems, controls, execution).
* SaaS Acumen: Strong understanding of SaaS business models, revenue recognition, unit economics, and growth metrics.
* Systems Builder: Experience implementing and scaling finance systems and tooling from relatively lightweight setups to more robust platforms.
* Leadership Presence: Trusted partner to executive leadership with the judgment and credibility to influence company\-wide decisions.
* Execution\-Oriented: Highly organized, detail\-oriented, and accountable, with a bias toward action and ownership.
* Remote Collaboration: Effective communicator able to operate seamlessly within a distributed leadership team.

**Benefits**

**Why Join Maneva?**

* + Play a defining role in scaling a cutting\-edge AI company transforming manufacturing.
	+ Join the leadership team at a pivotal inflection point in the company’s growth.
	+ Build the financial foundation that enables long\-term scale, impact, and value creation.
	+ Work with a technically exceptional and mission\-driven team solving real\-world problems.

***Important Notice: Protecting Your Personal Information***

*We are committed to ensuring the security and privacy of all applicants. Please be aware that our company will never ask for sensitive personal information, via email, phone call or text message. We also do not require payment from applicants for any part of the hiring process.*

*If you are contacted by someone claiming to represent our company and asking for such information, please do not respond. Instead, report the incident to us immediately at IT\-Security@Maneva.ai.*

title: Accounting Manager - Nonprofit
description:
**Job Overview**  
The ideal candidate will possess extensive experience in governmental and public accounting, with proficiency in various accounting software and financial analysis. As a key member of our team, you will ensure accurate financial reporting, effective cash management, and adherence to GAAP and other regulatory standards to support the organization’s mission\-driven objectives.

**Position Summary**

We are seeking a highly skilled and detail\-oriented Accounting Manager to join our nonprofit team and serve as the primary, hands\-on accounting professional to oversee the financial operations of our organization. This role requires a strong understanding of nonprofit accounting principles, grant management, regulatory compliance, financial reporting and overall financial operations. The ideal candidate will be proactive, organized, and detail\-oriented fast\-learner that is motivated to grow quickly into a Senior Financial Leadership role.

This role will work closely with organizational leadership and receive guidance from current Interim CFO. It provides a clear pathway to quickly advance into a Controller, Director of Finance, or Chief Financial Officer role, supported through mentorship and professional development.

**Key Responsibilities**

Accounting Operations

* Manage daily accounting activities, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll entries, journal entries, and general ledger maintenance.
* Perform month\-end close, bank reconciliations, balance sheet reconciliations, accruals, and depreciation schedules.
* Prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
* Ensure compliance with GAAP, nonprofit accounting standards, and internal controls.
* Administer payroll and payroll tax functions.
* Maintain proper documentation and support organizational financial policies and procedures.
* Work closely with leadership and program managers to provide financial guidance and operational insight.

Grant Accounting \& Compliance

* Track, manage, and report on all federal, state, and private grant budgets and expenditures.
* Prepare grant budgets, drawdowns, financial reports, invoices, and funder\-specific documentation.
* Ensure compliance with federal Uniform Guidance (2 CFR 200\), state regulations, and grantor requirements.
* Monitor grant spend vs. budget and ensure accurate allocation of direct and indirect costs.
* Serve as a financial liaison with funders and grant partners as needed.

Financial Reporting

* Prepare monthly internal financial reports for leadership.
* Support quarterly and annual reporting packages for the Board of Directors.
* Analyze variances and provide explanations to leadership and program teams.

Budgeting \& Forecasting

* Assist the Fractional CFO with annual budget development.
* Provide ongoing forecasting and spending analyses for grants and organizational programs.
* Support program managers in understanding and managing their budgets.

Audit \& External Reporting

* Prepare year\-end audit schedules and documentation.
* Support financial audits
* Assist in Form 990 preparation and compliance filings.

Cash Management

* Monitor cash flow, prepare cash reconciliations, and identify financial risks.
* Process vendor payments, credit card activity, and expense reimbursements.
* Oversee purchasing controls and ensure timely payment processes.

Systems \& Process Improvement

* Maintain the accounting system and recommend workflow improvements.
* Identify opportunities for automation suitable for a one\-person department.
* Strengthen and refine internal controls and financial procedures.

Leadership \& Growth

* Serve as the organization’s primary accounting resource and internal advisor.
* Partner with leadership on strategy, operations, and financial decision\-making.
* Opportunity to grow into a Controller, Director of Finance, or CFO role as the organization expands.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (CPA or master's preferred but not required).
* 4–7\+ years of progressive accounting experience, including nonprofit finance experience
* Strong knowledge of nonprofit fund accounting, grant compliance, and financial reporting.
* Experience with federal/state grant management, including drawdowns.
* Proficient in accounting software; QuickBooks preferred
* Advanced Excel skills and exceptional attention to detail.
* Experience with payroll processing and benefits administration.
* Strong analytical, communication, and problem\-solving skills.
* Ability to work independently, manage multiple deadlines, and collaborate across teams.

We encourage all interested applicants to apply, even if your experience doesn’t perfectly align with every qualification listed. If the role or title is not an exact match, we welcome the opportunity to discuss how your skills may fit within our growing organization.

description:
**Company**


Mechanism builds profitable companies and turns them into enterprises.


Since 2019, we’ve launched and scaled 10 companies while driving $200M\+ in revenue by treating company\-building as an engineering problem—not an art project. We combine rigorous validation, advanced analytics, and repeatable systems to dramatically increase the odds of success.


Today, we are pushing that model further: building an operating system for entrepreneurship that allows us to launch profitable, reinvesting companies with speed, precision, and minimal waste—companies designed to reach millions, and eventually billions, of people.


This role sits at the center of that system.

**The Role**
------------


The **Startup Growth Lead** is a founding\-level growth operator embedded full\-time in a single, heavily pre\-validated startup.

* You are not searching for an idea.
* You are not fighting bureaucracy.
* You are not spread thin across functions.


You are brought in to **build and prove the growth engine**—fast.


You will own growth end\-to\-end, from first experiments through repeatable, profitable scale. Your job is to turn a validated thesis, real resources, and a clean slate into a growth system that works—and then hand it off cleanly so the company can scale.


This is a co\-founder–level role in practice, with accountability for outcomes—not hand\-offs.

**How This Works at Mechanism**
-------------------------------


Each company pairs:

* A **high\-caliber fractional CEO**, responsible for overall company leadership and removing obstacles
* A **Startup Growth Lead**, responsible for designing, executing, and scaling the growth engine
* A centralized Mechanism team providing engineering, design, data, automation, and operational leverage
* Our explicit goal is to **maximize your leverage**—so small, correct inputs produce outsized results.


Think rolling boulders downhill, not pushing them uphill.

**What You Own**
----------------


You are accountable for:

* Growth strategy and prioritization
* Channel discovery, testing, and validation
* Building a repeatable, profitable acquisition system
* Customer understanding and feedback loops
* Proving positive unit economics and a path to scale

  

You are **not** responsible for:

* Inventory management
* Cash management or P\&L ownership
* Customer support
* General operations


Those functions exist to support growth—not dilute it.

**What You’ll Do**
------------------

* Own growth end\-to\-end for a newly launched company, with profitability as the primary KPI
* Design and execute the growth strategy across acquisition, conversion, retention, and monetization
* Build and maintain a clear growth model defining assumptions, targets, and constraints
* Design fast, disciplined experiments to validate demand, channels, pricing, and positioning

* Paid acquisition (especially Google Ads and Meta)
* Conversion rate optimization
* Landing pages and funnel testing

* Leverage AI and automation to increase speed, clarity, and effectiveness

The goal is to **launch, validate, scale, and transition** growth ownership in under 12 months—then move on to build the next company.

This role is ideal if you:

* Are a high\-ownership growth operator with founder\-level instincts
* Thrive in early\-stage ambiguity but demand real resources and leverage
* Move extremely fast without sacrificing rigor
* Care deeply about unit economics and profitability
* Want co\-founder impact without being diluted by non\-growth execution
* Want to work alongside some of the strongest operators of your career


This is not a traditional “Head of Growth” role inside an existing company. It is a chance to **repeatedly build the growth foundations of companies designed to matter**, inside a system optimized for speed, clarity, and compounding leverage.

**Requirements**

* 5\+ years building and scaling growth engines in early\-stage companies
* Deep hands\-on experience with Google Ads, Meta Ads, and CRO
* Strong first\-principles and systems thinking
* High\-speed, high\-quality execution under ambiguity
* Strong written and verbal communication
* Comfort leveraging AI, automation, and modern growth tooling

Unlimited PTO begins after successful completion of the introductory period.

Your job is to turn those goals into AI\-powered solutions that actually work in the real world—and to own the journey from first conversation live system real business impact.

**Shape what we build and why**

**Turn messy problems into shipped solutions**

**Drive adoption and long\-term impact**

* Work with client teams on rollout, enablement, and change management—so the systems you build actually get used.
* Monitor performance, gather qualitative and quantitative feedback, and push for improvements where they matter most.
* Bring back insights and patterns that inform Fractional’s internal playbooks, tooling, and product direction.

**Bring judgment and clarity**

* When requirements are fuzzy, data is messy, or customers change course, you’ll break the problem down and guide everyone toward the highest\-impact solution.
* Be the person in the room who can say, “Here’s what we’re actually trying to do, here’s what we know, here’s the plan.”

**What you bring:**
===================

**Customer\-facing, high\-stakes experience**

* You’ve led projects where customers were under pressure, stakeholders weren’t aligned, and the path wasn’t obvious.
* You’re comfortable pushing back, reframing the problem, and holding the line on quality.

**Real product \& delivery experience**

* You’ve built and shipped products or services in partnership with engineers and designers—ideally across multiple cycles.
* You know how to run an execution rhythm (stand\-ups, planning, tracking, retros) without turning it into process theater.

**Structured problem\-solving and communication**

* You ask good questions, structure chaos, and turn ambiguity into a plan.
* You can go from whiteboarding with execs to writing a crisp doc for engineers without losing the plot.

**Bias for action and ownership**

* You roll up your sleeves and make things happen, whether that’s writing a scrappy SQL query, drafting a support playbook, or jumping into a last\-minute exec demo.

**Experience range**

* Typically 4–8 years in product, consulting, implementations, or any role where execution and customer trust mattered more than your job title. (We care more about what you’ve done than the exact label on your resume.)

**Comfort with ambiguity and intensity**

* You like high\-energy environments, messy problems, and “we haven’t done this before” projects.
* You can juggle multiple customers, keep priorities straight, and make good calls with incomplete information.

**AI curiosity, not AI dogma**

* You don’t need deep AI expertise on day one. You do need curiosity, strong reasoning, and a desire to learn fast—and to overuse AI in your own workflow.

Joining Fractional AI as an AI Engineer, you’ll play a leading role in building and shipping AI applications for our customers \- from understanding customer needs to deploying solutions in their environments \- all while shaping our engineering and broader Fractional culture for the next 100\+ engineers.


By the time you’ve completed your second project, you’ll have shipped LLM applications across more companies and use cases than the vast majority of AI engineers in the world.

**What you bring to the table:**
================================

* You write exceptional code \+ deeply care about the craft of coding (4\+ years of experience): you build elegant, production\-ready code; you have strong proficiency across multiple programming languages
* You have a track record building with Large Language Models: you have experience building scalable applications with LLMs, using frameworks such as LangChain, LlamaIndex, etc.
* You love solving hard, new problems: you are comfortable self\-teaching, asking “why?,” and experimenting to solve problems you haven’t seen before
* You are ‘start\-up ready’: you jump in without instruction, embrace a ‘no job too big, no job too small’ mindset, and want to shape strategy and culture
* You are comfortable talking with customers: you deeply care about the customer and skillfully navigate customer conversations to ensure what we’re building meets their needs
* You are a great teammate: you are comfortable helping others (and asking for help), you champion integrity in everything, and want to build a one\-in\-a\-career culture of personal growth

**What you'll do:**
===================

* Design and develop custom AI solutions tailored to the unique needs of our customers, ensuring seamless integration and scalability
* Partner with a high\-caliber team across the full project lifestyle, from requirements gathering, to prototyping, system design, coding, testing, deployment, and support
* Actively shape our engineering and broader company culture \- from how we learn, to how we hire, to how we celebrate \- you’ll shape how we make Fractional a place we all love working

**Our tech stack:**
===================

* We’re generally tech stack agnostic \- we work in our customers’ environments and code bases. A lot, but definitely not all, of our work is in python.
* After working at Fractional AI for a few years, you’ll be an expert at using the various foundational models, building with tools like Langchain/Langsmith, and various other tools and frameworks (e.g., OpenPipe, Pinecone, ChromaDB).

**A day in the life:**
======================

* You're on a "Project Team" designed for that client's high\-impact AI need\- it may be automating a call center with AI phone agents or building an AI content moderation system – each project is different
* You’ll dive into one of the higher priority items for the morning (say building out an evals suite). You have a weekly standup with the customer (the CTO at the client) to chat through tradeoffs, progress, and timeline.
* You join team lunch (which doubles as the Fractional AI cross\-project standup) to hear about different projects we’re working on … the lunch will turn into a lively debate about Weights and Biases v. Braintrust capabilities.
* You’ll have some solo heads down time to continuing jamming on the high priority pieces for that print.
* Maybe you join a prospective customer call to share your perspective on what’s technically feasible on that potential project.

=========================

* This role will collaborate closely with Eddie, our Co\-Founder and CTO.
* You’ll work very closely with other engineers on the team \- most project teams consist of 2\-5 engineers and a PM.
* You’ll also spend a lot of time partnering with our CEO, Chris, and Chairman, Travis.

**Why you should (and shouldn’t) join us**
==========================================


We’re big believers in transparency and know joining a company is a big decision. We’re not the best fit for everyone and try to be clear on what we are and what we’re not so you make the choice that’s right for you.

**Why join Fractional?**
------------------------

* **Build on the forefront of applied AI:** You’ll have a front row seat to how the world’s leading companies are actually deploying AI solutions. By the time you’ve completed your second project, you’ll have shipped LLM applications across more companies and use cases than the vast majority of AI engineers in the world.
* **Solve big, real problems:** Companies come to us when they can’t solve some of their biggest problems themselves. For you, that means learning everyday, never getting bored, and working across a range of industries, customers, and products.
* **Learn with and from the best in person:** We're a team of senior engineers (some former founders, some former engineering leaders) who only want to work on high\-impact projects. Working elbow to elbow in our San Francisco, NYC, or Dubai offices means things like team lunches, quick brainstorming, and the right amount of banter.

**Why shouldn't you join Fractional?**
--------------------------------------

* **Preference for just speed or quality:** We love hacking things together for a proof of concept but ultimately our code will be put into production in our customers’ environments \- you need to enjoy balancing elegance and expediency.
* **Predictability is important to you:** You’ll be working across customers, programming languages, industries and projects, which means you won’t be becoming an expert in the same product suite or serving the same user day after day.
* **Customers aren’t your thing:** You’ll spend most of your time coding but will be closer to the customer than in most engineering roles. **About Vet At Your Door:**

Vet At Your Door (VAYD) is a veterinarian\-owned and operated house call practice serving communities across Maine since 2015\. Founded on the belief that the best care happens at home, we bring high\-quality, compassionate veterinary medicine directly to our clients’ doors.

We are transforming from à la carte veterinary care to a membership\-based care operating system as a core pillar of a 10× revenue growth plan over the next 2\.5 years, with the goal of becoming the first national employee\-owned (ESOP) veterinary practice by 2028\.

**About The Role:**

**What**: This is anExecutive Operator position in a High\-Growth Healthcare Services company.

**Where:** While this is a mostly remote role, we prefer it if you are located in the Northeast and can travel to our headquarters in Brunswick, Maine as needed.

**Type:** This can be fractional or a full time employee.

**Reports to:** CEO

**Start:** Immediate

**Your Mission:**This is not a typical marketing role focused on advertising and messaging. Rather, it is about rebuilding how care is delivered, chosen, and experienced.

Your mission is to make membership the obvious, frictionless default for how clients engage with Vet At Your Door, by owning the end\-to\-end systems that drive adoption, retention, and long\-term value.

So, if you thrive in ambiguity, high stakes, and building systems that scale nationally, keep reading!

**What You Will Own:** 

You will own the end\-to\-end membership transformation, including:

* Designing membership as the default care model, not an add\-on.
* Working with our CTO and Operations team to re\-architect intake, scheduling, visit flow, follow\-up, and billing to support membership.
* Creating a behavioral conversion system (defaults, timing, friction removal), not a sales funnel.
* Defining how and when à la carte care is constrained and sunset (except for euthanasia \- we will always do this as a pay\-as\-you\-go service).
* Building a repeatable, scalable membership playbook for national expansion.
* Ensuring the system supports clinical excellence, trust, and long\-term relationships.
* Partnering with clinical, operations, and tech leaders to execute fast while considering revenue, reputation, and staff morale.
* Your main KPI is patient membership conversion; current clients and new clients.

**The Background We’re Looking For:**

You have already done something like this, ideally with:

* Healthcare, veterinary, concierge human medicine, home health, dental, or behavioral health for a business with legacy customers.
* A real transition away from à la carte or transactional pricing.

**Traits That Will Make You Successful In This Role:**

* You have a thorough understanding of the customer mindset.
* You also understand and work well with tech and operations.
* You operate calmly under pressure.
* You have a bias toward action over perfection.
* You are comfortable making consequential decisions with imperfect information, while actively managing risk and course\-correcting quickly.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive executive compensation.
* Performance\-based upside.
* Structured long\-term rewards aligned with company growth
* Benefits \- We offer employees working 32\+ hours per week a well\-rounded benefits package designed to support you both professionally and personally.

**Interested In Learning More?** Please email Lisa Wright, our VP of Talent, at lwright@vetatyourdoor.com.

Job Type: Full\-time

* Health insurance

* Paid time off

You’ll build forecasts and models, analyze performance, and provide insights that drive decisions — while also stepping into AR/AP workflows, ensuring cash timing accuracy, and supporting month\-end close.

* Own and update the company’s financial models and assumptions
* Create scenario analyses (pricing, hiring, inventory planning, channel mix, etc.)

* Analyze unit economics, gross margins, and product/channel profitability
* Prepare and maintain budget vs. actual reporting with clear variance explanations
* Translate financial results into insights and recommendations for leadership

* Step into AR/AP tools (QuickBooks, Bill.com, etc.) to resolve issues and streamline workflows

* Partner with accounting to ensure clean monthly close
* Compile internal reporting packages (KPIs, cash trends, contribution margins, etc.)

**Cross\-Functional Partnership**

* Support Operations with inventory planning, landed cost updates, and PO forecasting
* Work with Sales and Marketing to model revenue, channel performance, and demand
* Collaborate with the fractional CFO on financial strategy, budgeting, and board materials

**Qualifications**

* 4–7 years of experience in FP\&A, strategic finance, or a related field
* Strong financial modeling skills; able to build and maintain complex models
* Experience owning or supporting AR/AP processes in a small or growing finance team
* Comfortable with both strategic analysis and hands\-on operational tasks
* Strong communication skills; able to partner with non\-finance teams
* Experience supporting month\-end close and working with accounting teams

* CPG, e\-commerce, DTC, or inventory\-based business experience
* Experience with tools like QuickBooks, Bill.com, Expensify, Mosaic, Cube, or Fathom
* Understanding of landed costs, cost accounting, or inventory analysis
* SQL or BI tool familiarity
* CPA or CFA

* AR/AP runs smoothly with minimal executive oversight
* Forecasts are reliable and regularly updated
* Leadership has full visibility into cash, margins, and performance trends
* Books remain clean and close smoothly each month
* The COO regains the significant time currently spent on modeling and financial operations

* $85,000 \- $115,000 annual salary, depending on experience/qualifications
* $500/month QSEHRA reimbursement

description:
**About Malloy Industries**  
Malloy Industries connects B2B CEOs (typically $1M–$50M revenue, 10–100 employees) with vetted fractional executives who help bring structure to chaos. We’re known for being relentlessly generous, vulnerably trustworthy, enthusiastically fun, independently productive, and flexibly learning—and we take client outcomes seriously.

We’re expanding our Fractional Executive Network and are looking for experienced Fractional COOs / Directors of Operations to join our roster for potential client collaborations.

Important: This is NOT a full\-time job

Malloy Industries is building our Fractional Executive Roster. This posting is for experienced operations leaders who want to be considered for future fractional client engagements. If you’re looking for a W\-2, full\-time internal role, this won’t be the right fit.

**The Opportunity (Fractional / Contract)**  
As a fractional COO / Director of Operations in our roster, you may be matched with growth\-stage clients who need operational leadership—often 10–20 hours/week—to build systems, cadence, accountability, and execution muscle.

While we can’t guarantee a specific volume of client work, members join because we invest in their success with meaningful support and a strong matching process.

**What You’ll Do (Director of Ops / Fractional COO level)**  
You’ll operate as a senior operator for founder\-led companies—owning outcomes, not task lists. Depending on the client, you may:

* Lead operational strategy \+ execution across functions (Sales, Marketing, Delivery, Finance, People Ops)
* Build and run an operating cadence: weekly leadership meetings, KPI dashboards/scoreboards, quarterly priorities, action tracking
* Create role clarity \+ accountability (DRI ownership, meeting hygiene, decision rights, escalation paths)
* Design and implement core business systems: SOPs, workflows, handoffs, documentation
* Drive cross\-functional project management for high\-impact initiatives (process redesign, onboarding improvements, tool rollouts)
* Improve capacity planning and resource allocation (what gets done, by whom, and when)
* Partner directly with the CEO to translate strategy into execution and keep priorities on track

**Who This Is For (and who it’s not)**  
This is a fit if you’ve been responsible for making the business run, not just supporting someone who does. This roster is specifically for senior operations leaders who have owned operating systems, cross\-functional execution, and business outcomes.

**This is NOT an Executive Assistant / Administrative Assistant role.**

**Must\-haves**

* 8\+ years experience in operations with leadership scope (COO, Director of Operations, Head of Ops, Ops Lead with team/process ownership, etc.)
* Proven experience building and running operating rhythms (KPIs, weekly leadership meetings, quarterly priorities)
* Experience owning cross\-functional projects end\-to\-end (not just scheduling/follow\-ups)
* Ability to create process documentation \+ SOPs and drive adoption across a team
* Comfortable pushing back, clarifying priorities, and driving accountability with senior stakeholders
* US\-based; able to work remotely with US clients

**Strongly preferred**

* You’ve managed a team (Ops, PMs, admins, coordinators) and/or owned vendors/budgets
* You’ve supported a scaling company (10–100 employees) through growth/change

**Nice\-to\-haves**

* Prior fractional/consulting experience
* Experience implementing systems/tools
* Operations training/certification

**Benefits of Joining the Malloy Industries Network**

* Qualified lead pipeline delivering pre\-vetted, growth\-stage companies ready to collaborate
* Seamless back\-office support that handles all contracts, invoicing, and payment processing
* Active success partnership featuring weekly check\-ins to support you and monthly client reviews to protect your work
* Maximized earning potential by eliminating business development costs and friction

**Compensation**  
Compensation varies by client engagement and scope and will be discussed during the matching process.

**How to Apply**   
Applications are only accepted through our apply page and roundtable process. (required)

**Step 1: RSVP to “Explore Collaborations” (Executive Roundtable)**  
This is the essential first step. Once a month, we host a roundtable to personally meet potential members.

* You’ll introduce yourself and your services to our team
* We’ll explain our business model, the mutual referral agreement, and how we support our executives
* We decide together if there’s a mutual fit for collaboration

This is a conversation, not an interrogation.

**Step 2: Complete the Malloy Industries Member Application**  
Complete immediately after booking your roundtable session: https://www.malloyindustries.com/apply

Please take your time to provide detailed, thoughtful responses—especially for your **Value Prop**—because this is what we literally copy and paste to recommend you to potential clients.

**Fractional Chief Operating Officer (Fractional COO)**
-------------------------------------------------------

**Pathology Specialists of Arizona (PSA)**  

**Location: HYBRID (Arizona) \| Executive Leadership Role \| .75 FTE (30 hours per week)**  

**FLSA Status: Exempt**

### **About the Role**


Pathology Specialists of Arizona (PSA) is seeking an experienced **Fractional Chief Operating Officer (COO)** to provide enterprise\-level operational leadership across its affiliated pathology groups, including Phoenix Pathology, Tucson Pathology Associates, Pathology Services, and Sun City Pathologists. For Clin\-Path Associates, this role provides targeted strategic and contractual support related to key health system and payer partnerships, rather than day\-to\-day operational oversight. This role also supports broader healthcare systems, clients, payors, and organizational initiatives as requested by Group leadership.


This is a senior leadership position designed as a **.75 FTE fractional role**, ideal for an experienced healthcare executive who can provide strong strategic and operational leadership without a traditional full\-time structure.


The Fractional COO partners closely with physician leaders, accounting teams, legal counsel, and external vendors to ensure strong performance, compliance, and sustainability across the organization.


The role reports directly to the PSA Executive Committee.

**What You Will Do**
--------------------

### **Strategic Leadership and Operations**

* Develop and implement strategic growth plans for PSA and its affiliated pathology groups
* Lead business process improvements to maximize efficiency across operations and billing functions
* Provide operational guidance to the PSA Executive Committee on organizational strategy and business development
* Build and maintain strong relationships with hospitals, healthcare facilities, payers, clients, and key stakeholders
* Ensure compliance with CMS, CLIA, OSHA, HIPAA, and other regulatory bodies
* Maintain operational oversight of:


	+ Pathology Billing Services (PBS)
	+ HR and benefits coordination
	+ Credentialing and provider enrollment
* Provide operational support to individual Groups upon formal request and approval, with scope tailored to the governance and operational structure of each entity

### **Financial Oversight and Operational Collaboration**

* Provide executive oversight of financial operations in collaboration with PSA accounting staff, Group accounting teams, and external vendors
* Partner with internal and external financial professionals to support budgeting, forecasting, reporting, and operational decision\-making
* Oversee vendor relationships related to accounting, tax services, benefits administration, retirement plans, and consulting partners
* Support regulatory and compliance\-related financial processes including payroll reporting, benefit plan reporting, and tax filings
* Collaborate with Group Leaders on financial planning, budget development, performance analysis, and evaluation of contract financial impact
* Support managed care strategy by providing operational and financial input related to hospital, payer, and client relationships
* Ensure operational processes support financial compliance and organizational sustainability


All financial oversight activities are performed in a collaborative, non\-CFO capacity unless otherwise approved by the PSA Executive Committee.

### **Billing and Revenue Cycle Management**

* Direct Pathology Billing Services (PBS) to ensure alignment with industry best practices
* Oversee billing workflows to maximize collections and minimize revenue leakage
* Collaborate with hospital and insurance partners to support reimbursement optimization
* Monitor payer trends, denials management, and claims performance

description:
**Executive Summary**


**Business Development \& Strategic Partnerships Lead (Fractional)**



Black Fox Global is seeking a senior, fractional Business Development \&  

Strategic Partnerships Lead to advance sustainable, values\-aligned  

revenue growth without compromising delivery quality, culture, or system  

health.



This role is structured as a 90–120 day pilot to assess whether focused,  

senior\-level business development capacity can convert strong inbound  

interest, long\-standing relationships, and market credibility into contracted,  

well\-aligned engagements. The role is additive to leadership\-led business  

development efforts and is evaluated on the quality and progression of  

owned opportunities, not sole responsibility for firm\-wide revenue.



The role prioritizes judgment over volume, with success demonstrated  

through disciplined advancement of a limited number of high\-fit  

opportunities, strength of relationships advanced, and tangible revenue  

momentum.



Black Fox Global primarily serves NGOs with approximately $1M–$10M in  

annual revenue, at a stage where the right strategic and fundraising  

support materially changes outcomes.



The ideal candidate brings senior credibility and direct outcomes  

responsibility in trust\-based environments, operates comfortably peer\-to\-  

peer with founders, executives, and funders, and advances conversations  

toward committed engagements with integrity and discernment.



Compensation includes a $5,000–$6,000 monthly retainer and a 3–7%  

performance\-based bonus tied to contracted revenue the individual  

materially advances.



This initial engagement also serves as a learning period. Where there is  

strong fit and mutual interest, insights may inform longer\-term continuity or  

succession considerations — optional, emergent, and never assumed.


**Full Description**


**Black Fox Global \| Business Development \& Strategic Partnerships Lead \|**  

**Fractional; Remote**



15 hours/week \| Fractional, remote role with an initial 90–120 day  

engagement designed to assess fit and inform potential next phases.  

Conference participation may be included.


**About Black Fox Global (BFG)**



Black Fox Global is a global fundraising firm that has partnered with NGOs,  

foundations, and mission\-driven organizations around the world for more  

than 12 years.



We support leaders by helping them mobilize resources, build durable  

funder relationships, and scale impact without compromising integrity,  

exhausting their teams, or relying on transactional fundraising tactics.


**Our work is known for:**


* Outcome\-driven partnerships that build durable, independent capacity for NGOs across regions and issue areas.
* Longstanding, trusted relationships across the funding and NGO ecosystem.
* Clear thinking, open knowledge\-sharing, and consistently strong results.


As the sector evolves, we are also investing in AI\-enabled tools and  

intelligent systems to strengthen fundraising expertise access, strategy,  

decision\-making, and long\-term sustainability.


**Why This Role Exists**



This new role exists to test whether focused, senior\-level business  

development capacity can unlock sustainable revenue without  

compromising delivery quality or culture. Black Fox Global benefits from  

consistent inbound interest, long\-standing relationships ready for  

reactivation, and a strong but under\-leveraged trusted presence across the impact ecosystem, all of which warrant intentional, senior\-level cultivation and follow\-through.



Beyond revenue outcomes, this initial engagement is designed to inform  

longer\-term leadership and founder succession planning, should there be  

mutual interest and demonstrated fit. Succession exploration is optional,  

emergent, and not implied as an expectation.


**Initial Engagement Focus (First 90–120 Days)**



The initial phase is designed to assess alignment, market signal, and  

tangible revenue momentum. While Black Fox Global does not pursue  

misaligned or pressured closing, business generation is a core expectation  

during this period.



Success is demonstrated by the ability to move qualified opportunities  

meaningfully forward, from opening doors, through trust\-based  

conversations, to committed, values\-aligned engagements, in ways that  

strengthen both revenue and reputation.



Recognizing that trust\-based NGO decision cycles vary, evaluation  

considers not only revenue outcomes, but also the progression and quality  

of owned opportunities, including movement toward decision, strength of  

relationships advanced, and alignment with delivery capacity.


**Areas of Responsibility \| Priority Outcomes**



This role is designed to be additive and complementary to existing  

business development efforts led by Black Fox Global leadership. While the  

Business Development \& Strategic Partnerships Lead will own and  

advance a defined subset of priority opportunities, overall firm revenue  

generation is a shared responsibility across leadership.



Success in this role is assessed based on the quality and progression of  

created and owned opportunities, contribution to overall pipeline health,  

and alignment with delivery capacity. Responsibilities include:


* Re\-activate dormant relationships and advance them toward contracted engagement, with a primary focus on NGOs operating within Black Fox Global's core growth segment: Organizations with approximately $1M\-$10M in annual revenue, who are:


* Established enough to benefit meaningfully from systems,


 strategy, and relationship\-building  

* Still at a stage where the right support materially changes


 outcomes  

* Led by ambitious, mission\-driven leaders seeking greater


 clarity, confidence, and funder strategy  

* Ready to translate advisory and fundraising support into real,


 sustainable revenue growth
* Initiate and cultivate new, high\-quality conversations and


introductions, leveraging trusted networks and targeted sector  

engagement to convert aligned interest into qualified opportunities.
* Assess funder appetite and broader sector dynamics related to


capacity\-building, advisory, and fundraising support for organizations  

in this stage of growth.
* Advance select warm or well\-aligned opportunities through proposal,


decision, and contracted engagement.
* Leverage the Black Fox Global ecosystem, reputation, and


relationships to build a strong pipeline of NGO partners for whom this  

work is both timely and transformative.

In practice, this role prioritizes disciplined advancement of a select number  

of well\-aligned opportunities. Within the first 60 \- 90 days, the expectation is  

focused engagement across approximately 8 \- 10 priority opportunities that  

are actively moving toward decision or already contracted, alongside lighter  

stewardship of a broader set of warm and longer\-term relationships within  

the Black Fox Global / sector ecosystem.



Success in this role depends upon sound judgment about where to  

concentrate effort, how to pace trust\-based conversations, and when to  

advance, pause, or decline opportunities in service of sustainable growth  

and delivery quality.



Longer\-term stewardship, expanded scope, and deeper revenue ownership  

may be explored if this initial phase demonstrates both fit and results. More  

in the ‘Growth \& Continuity’ section.


**Market Presence**



Every external interaction this person has serves as a quiet signal of who  

we are, how we lead, and what we stand for.


* Represent BFG with professionalism, discernment, and gravitas.
* Communicate our ethos of generosity and excellence through judgment and clarity.


**Technology\-Enabled Futures \& AI Curiosity**



AI fluency is not required for initial success in this role. However, curiosity  

about technology\-enabled futures will become increasingly relevant as  

Black Fox Global evolves. We are actively exploring the development of an  

AI\-enabled fundraising and strategy agent grounded in Black Fox Global’s  

methodology, ethics/ethos, and relational intelligence. Candidates who are  

excited by innovative ways to serve at scale will be especially well\-aligned.


**Collaboration with Founder \& Operations**



This role works in close collaboration with the Founder and Operations to  

ensure business development decisions are grounded in delivery reality,  

protect system health, and support long\-term sustainability.


* Work closely with the Founder and operational leadership in a spirit of partnership and shared accountability.
* Collaborate closely with Operations to ensure tight alignment from business development through delivery, including clear handoffs, shared expectations, and consistent client experience.
* Advance opportunities with a clear understanding of delivery capacity, system health, and operational constraints, ensuring what we promise externally can be delivered with excellence.
* Surface insights early to support sustainable planning, execution, and client success.

  


**Ideal Candidate**



This role is designed for someone who brings senior judgment, real closing  

responsibility, and calm authority to business development in trust\-based  

environments.


***You are likely:***


* A senior sales, partnerships, or fundraising leader who has held direct responsibility for advancing and closing contracted engagements.
* Someone who has operated in high\-stakes executive contexts within the impact, philanthropic, or NGO ecosystem, and is now seeking a portfolio\-style role that prioritizes meaning, discernment, and sustainability.
* Deeply experienced in trust\-based, relational environments, where progress is built through credibility, timing, and judgment rather than transactional pressure.
* Comfortable engaging NGO executives, funders, and institutional partners globally, and guiding conversations toward clear, values\-aligned commitments.
* A recognized and respected presence within leading global convening and networks shaping the social impact sector.
* Grounded in mission\-driven work and "sacred sales" or fundraising practices, with curiosity about how technology and AI\-enabled systems may responsibly support future impact.


***You bring:***


* A demonstrated track record of moving high\-value engagements from early trust\-building through decision, commitment, and contract.
* The ability to balance ambition with restraint, pursuing growth that strengthens systems, relationships, and reputation over time.
* A collaborative, partnership\-oriented approach that complements leadership teams.
* Strong judgment around what to pursue, and what to decline, in service of protecting team capacity and system health.

trust\-building through decision, commitment, and contract.  

The ability to balance ambition with restraint, pursuing growth that  

strengthens systems, relationships, and reputation over time.


**Culture \& How We Lead**



At Black Fox Global, leadership looks like:


* Generosity without self\-erasure.
* Direct, respectful communication grounded in care and accountability.
* Ambition in service of mission.
* Power held responsibly.
* We care deeply about trust, clarity, and system health.


**Growth \& Continuity**



For the right person, strong contribution may lead to expanded scope,  

elevated leadership designation, longer\-term continuity, profit participation  

and partner\-track exploration. Nothing is assumed or rushed; any evolution  

would be grounded in results, trust, and mutual fit.


**Compensation**



Compensation includes:


* A monthly retainer of $5,000–$6,000, based upon experience and


scope  

* A meaningful performance\-based bonus (3–7%) tied to contracted


revenue that the individual materially advances

The performance bonus is designed to:


* Reward real revenue outcomes, not activity or volume
* Align incentives with values\-led, sustainable growth
* Support fair attribution, including co\-selling with leadership
* Preserve delivery quality, system health, and long\-term trust


Bonus eligibility reflects material contribution to opportunities advanced from early engagement through decision and contracted commitment, whether independently or in partnership with Black Fox Global leadership.



This structure applies to the initial scope of work for the 90–120 day  

engagement.


**Equal Opportunity \& Inclusive Culture**



At Black Fox Global, we are committed to building a culture of belonging  

that provides opportunities for all qualified individuals. We believe a work  

environment that embraces and incorporates diverse strengths,  

backgrounds, and viewpoints makes us stronger and more effective in  

realizing our mission to advance meaningful social impact. We welcome  

candidates who share our commitment to equity, collaboration, and  

generosity, and we encourage applications from people of all races,  

ethnicities, genders, sexual orientations, abilities, ages, and experiences.


**Application Process**



Black Fox Global uses Fitzii to support a thoughtful, values\-aligned hiring  

process. **Please complete the following steps** as part of the application
